object.property: ((here.suDownLinkMIR if here.suDownLinkMIR is not None else 3000) * 1024) / 8 * .75
((here.suUpLinkMIR if here.suUpLinkMIR is not None else 3000) * 1024) / 8 * .75
RF Send - Retry Maxed out at AP
RF Send - Retry maxed Out at SU

import re
if evt.summary.startswith('threshold of high su count '): m = re.search("threshold of [^:]+: current value ([\d\.]+)", evt.message) currentvalue = (int(float(m.groups()[0]))) evt.summary = "Warning! Access Point has an excessive number of Subscriber Units: " + str(currentvalue) elif evt.summary.startswith('threshold of high utilization '): fs_id = device.prepId(evt.component)
for f in device.os.interfaces(): if f.id != fs_id: continue
# Extract the percent and utilization from the summary m = re.search("threshold of [^:]+: current value ([\d\.]+)", evt.message) if not m: continue currentusage = (float(m.groups()[0])) * 8
p = (currentusage / f.speed) * 100
if (evt.severity > 0): # Check the speed to determine the appropriate conversion # Gbps utilization if currentusage > 1000000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000000 evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f Gbps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p)
# Mbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000 evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f Mbps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p)
# Kbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000: Usage = currentusage / 1000 evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f Kbps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p)
# bps utilization elif currentusage < 1000: Usage = currentusage evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f bps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p) else: evt.summary = "access point utilization has returned to normal"
evt.message = evt.summary break

import re
if evt.summary.startswith('threshold of high su count '): m = re.search("threshold of [^:]+: current value ([\d\.]+)", evt.message) currentvalue = (int(float(m.groups()[0]))) evt.summary = "Warning! Access Point has an excessive number of Subscriber Units: " + str(currentvalue) elif evt.summary.startswith('threshold of high utilization '): fs_id = device.prepId(evt.component)
for f in device.os.interfaces(): if f.id != fs_id: continue
# Extract the percent and utilization from the summary m = re.search("threshold of [^:]+: current value ([\d\.]+)", evt.message) if not m: continue currentusage = (float(m.groups()[0])) * 8
p = (currentusage / f.speed) * 100
if (evt.severity > 0): # Check the speed to determine the appropriate conversion # Gbps utilization if currentusage > 1000000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000000 evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f Gbps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p)
# Mbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000 evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f Mbps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p)
# Kbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000: Usage = currentusage / 1000 evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f Kbps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p)
# bps utilization elif currentusage < 1000: Usage = currentusage evt.summary = "access point is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION: %3.2f bps (%3.2f%% of maximum)" % (Usage, p) else: evt.summary = "access point utilization has returned to normal"
evt.message = evt.summary break

import re
fs_id = device.prepId(evt.component) for f in device.trangoSubscriberUnit(): if f.id != fs_id: continue
suinfo = ""
if f.suRemarks: suinfo = f.id + " (" + f.suRemarks + ")" else: suinfo = f.id
# if not a VIP customer do not bother to create the event if (not f.suRemarks.startswith("vip-")): evt._action="drop" break
# Extract the percent and utilization from the summary m = re.search("threshold of [^:]+: current value ([\d\.]+)", evt.message) if not m: continue currentusage = (float(m.groups()[0])) * 8 evtKey = evt.eventKey
# Whether Input or Output Traffic if evtKey == "suEthOutOctets_suEthOutOctets|high utilization (inbound)": evtNewKey = "Inbound" p = (currentusage / (f.suDownLinkMIR * 1024)) * 100 elif evtKey == "suEthInOctets_suEthInOctets|high utilization (outbound)": evtNewKey = "Outbound" p = (currentusage / (f.suUpLinkMIR * 1024)) * 100
if (evt.severity > 0): # Check the speed to determine the appropriate conversion # Gbps utilization if currentusage > 1000000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000000 evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f Gbps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p)
# Mbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000 evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f Mbps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p)
# Kbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000: Usage = currentusage / 1000 evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f Kbps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p)
# bps utilization elif currentusage < 1000: Usage = currentusage evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f bps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p) else: evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " utilization has returned to normal ("+ evtNewKey + ")"
evt.message = evt.summary break

import re
fs_id = device.prepId(evt.component) for f in device.trangoSubscriberUnit(): if f.id != fs_id: continue
suinfo = ""
if f.suRemarks: suinfo = f.id + " (" + f.suRemarks + ")" else: suinfo = f.id
# if not a VIP customer do not bother to create the event if (not f.suRemarks.startswith("vip-")): evt._action="drop" break
# Extract the percent and utilization from the summary m = re.search("threshold of [^:]+: current value ([\d\.]+)", evt.message) if not m: continue currentusage = (float(m.groups()[0])) * 8 evtKey = evt.eventKey
# Whether Input or Output Traffic if evtKey == "suEthOutOctets_suEthOutOctets|high utilization (inbound)": evtNewKey = "Inbound" p = (currentusage / (f.suDownLinkMIR * 1024)) * 100 elif evtKey == "suEthInOctets_suEthInOctets|high utilization (outbound)": evtNewKey = "Outbound" p = (currentusage / (f.suUpLinkMIR * 1024)) * 100
if (evt.severity > 0): # Check the speed to determine the appropriate conversion # Gbps utilization if currentusage > 1000000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000000 evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f Gbps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p)
# Mbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000000: Usage = currentusage / 1000000 evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f Mbps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p)
# Kbps utilization elif currentusage > 1000: Usage = currentusage / 1000 evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f Kbps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p)
# bps utilization elif currentusage < 1000: Usage = currentusage evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " is experiencing HIGH UTILIZATION ("+ evtNewKey + "): %3.2f bps (%3.2f%% of MIR)" % (Usage, p) else: evt.summary = "subscriber unit " + suinfo + " utilization has returned to normal ("+ evtNewKey + ")"
evt.message = evt.summary break

MIB for Trango M-900S AP Devices
MIB for Trango M-900S AP Devices
New Default gateway. It will be saved to non-volatile memory and activated in 5 secs.
New Default gateway. It will be saved to non-volatile memory and activated in 5 secs.
New IP address. It will be saved to non-volatile memory and activated in 5 secs.
New IP address. It will be saved to non-volatile memory and activated in 5 secs.
New Subnet mask. It will be saved to non-volatile memory and activated in 5 secs.

It specifies the current polarization or antenna the radio operates on. v for vertical polarization, h for horizontal polarization and e for external antenna.
It specifies the current polarization or antenna the radio operates on. v for vertical polarization, h for horizontal polarization and e for external antenna.
It specifies the current channel number the radio operates on.
It specifies the current channel number the radio operates on.

RF rx threshold (in dBm). It specifies the receiver sensitivity of the AP. By default, the radio's sensitivity is -82dBm. The higher the threshold is, the less sensitive the radio will be. Its range is from -98 to -55.

RF rx threshold (in dBm). It specifies the receiver sensitivity of the AP. By default, the radio's sensitivity is -82dBm. The higher the threshold is, the less sensitive the radio will be. Its range is from -98 to -55.

RF target RSSI (in dBm). It specifies the target RSSI from all SUs to the AP. Based on this parameter, the AP can power level each SU so that it receives same level of signal strength from all SUs, regardless far or near. Note that when you set the Target RSSI from SU, you need to consider AP's RF Rx Threshold value. The Target RSSI from SU must be 5dB higher than the RF Rx Threshold. When the RF Rx Threshold is disabled, the setting of the Target RSSI from SU shall be no less than -75dBm.

RF target RSSI (in dBm). It specifies the target RSSI from all SUs to the AP. Based on this parameter, the AP can power level each SU so that it receives same level of signal strength from all SUs, regardless far or near. Note that when you set the Target RSSI from SU, you need to consider AP's RF Rx Threshold value. The Target RSSI from SU must be 5dB higher than the RF Rx Threshold. When the RF Rx Threshold is disabled, the setting of the Target RSSI from SU shall be no less than -75dBm.
RF tx power (in dBm). It specifies the power output of the radio, excluding the antenna gain. Check parameters aprfTxPowerMax and apismTxPowerMin for power setting range.
RF tx power (in dBm). It specifies the power output of the radio, excluding the antenna gain. Check parameters aprfTxPowerMax and apismTxPowerMin for power setting range.
The maximum Tx power value can be set (in dBm).
The maximum Tx power value can be set (in dBm).
The minimum Tx power value can be set (in dBm).
The minimum Tx power value can be set (in dBm).

RF channel 1 frequency (in MHz). It allows you to create your own channel instead of the manufacturing defaults in the AP. Keep in mind that channel width is 6MHz, and the frequency specified here is the center frequency.

RF channel 1 frequency (in MHz). It allows you to create your own channel instead of the manufacturing defaults in the AP. Keep in mind that channel width is 6MHz, and the frequency specified here is the center frequency.

RF channel 2 frequency (in MHz). It allows you to create your own channel instead of the manufacturing defaults in the AP. Keep in mind that channel width is 6MHz, and the frequency specified here is the center frequency.

RF channel 3 frequency (in MHz). It allows you to create your own channel instead of the manufacturing defaults in the AP. Keep in mind that channel width is 6MHz, and the frequency specified here is the center frequency.

RF channel 4 frequency (in MHz). It allows you to create your own channel instead of the manufacturing defaults in the AP. Keep in mind that channel width is 6MHz, and the frequency specified here is the center frequency.

RF channel 4 frequency (in MHz). It allows you to create your own channel instead of the manufacturing defaults in the AP. Keep in mind that channel width is 6MHz, and the frequency specified here is the center frequency.
This switch enables or disables the blocking of Ethernet control packet except ICMP and ARP to reduce the amount of uneccessary overhead introduced to the wireless link.
This switch enables or disables the blocking of Ethernet control packet except ICMP and ARP to reduce the amount of uneccessary overhead introduced to the wireless link.
When it is turned on, then the AP is accessible for configuring via web browser (e.g. IE or Nescape).
When it is turned on, then the AP is accessible for configuring via web browser (e.g. IE or Nescape).

This switch enables or disables the peer-to-peer feature among SUs through the AP. Before this switch is turned on, all SUs that want to communicate with each other have to be assigned to the same group.

This switch enables or disables the peer-to-peer feature among SUs through the AP. Before this switch is turned on, all SUs that want to communicate with each other have to be assigned to the same group.
This switch enables or disables the TFTP operation. When it is turned on, then the AP will be ready for code download.
This switch enables or disables the TFTP operation. When it is turned on, then the AP will be ready for code download.
It allows TCP/IP access into the AP via the RF link when opmode is on.
It allows TCP/IP access into the AP via the RF link when opmode is on.
AP ID. Each AP in a cluster shall have unique AP ID.
AP ID. Each AP in a cluster shall have unique AP ID.
Engage AP unit to ap operation mode.

Cluster that the AP belongs to. All APs and SUs in the same cluster shall have the same Base ID.
Cluster that the AP belongs to. All APs and SUs in the same cluster shall have the same Base ID.
The operation mode (on or off) the radio is on after reboot/power cycle.
The operation mode (on or off) the radio is on after reboot/power cycle.
Maximum Information Rate (in Mbps), the AP allows the network to utilize before enforcing DownLink CIR on each subscriber.

It is peer-to-peer group this SU belongs to. With the SU to SU switch is turned on, SUs in the same peer-to-peer group can communicate to each other via the AP. There are totally 15 groups available. Note that the SU shall be set to priority user for this feature to improve latency.

It is peer-to-peer group this SU belongs to. With the SU to SU switch is turned on, SUs in the same peer-to-peer group can communicate to each other via the AP. There are totally 15 groups available. Note that the SU shall be set to priority user for this feature to improve latency.

It is service level value, regular or priority, of a SU. The AP will poll priority user more often, thus better network latency as the result. As the network latency varies based on the number of subscriber units the AP serves, priority user is guaranteed that the latency is NOT greater than 100ms regardless of the size of the network.

It is service level value, regular or priority, of a SU. The AP will poll priority user more often, thus better network latency as the result. As the network latency varies based on the number of subscriber units the AP serves, priority user is guaranteed that the latency is NOT greater than 100ms regardless of the size of the network.
